cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly west-northwest, then turning northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast and inland through the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City/Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of Mississippi River to Grand Isle LA and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA; Tropical Storm Watch east of Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle LA; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas, and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast (mainly Louisiana and Mississippi coasts)
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤17% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches possible in outer bands Friday–Saturday, locally higher in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents could affect vessel approaches and small-craft operations.
